{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3475200,"name":null,"username":"pixelpunk","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/96bed5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-08T13:01:12.260Z","cooked":"

Hi Chief Delphi - programming question from a non-programmer,

Is it necessary to re-image the roboRIO every season? If someone could provide a link saying why we have to do it that would be immensely helpful. Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-01-08T13:01:12.260Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":83.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":480127,"topic_slug":"roborio-imaging","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64486,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/roborio-imaging/480127/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3475226,"name":"","username":"EmerqldWither","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emerqldwither/{size}/226176_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-08T13:29:03.193Z","cooked":"

We reimage to essentially “update” the OS of the RoboRIO. The updates can be done to make changes such as changing safety margins (ex: last year as they changed the safety limits around packet loss to help reduce runaway robots).

R701 is the answer.

ROBOTS must be controlled via 1 programmable NI roboRIO or roboRIO 2.0
 (P/N am3000 or am3000a, both versions referred to throughout this manual
as “roboRIO”), with image version 2025_v2.0 or later.
